Wolfgang Schulz.description: studying for exams. (conversing about promoting diversity and inclusion, Wolfgang Schulz and Eddy Lin discuss collaborating with Black-owned businesses, highlighting Black LGBTQ+ individuals, involving diverse youth in event planning, providing resources and support, addressing unconscious bias and microaggressions, incorporating Black music genres and literature, showcasing local Black artists, offering educational resources on Black history and contributions, collaborating with community leaders and activists, providing mentorship for young Black individuals, planning workshops on allyship and privilege, working with educational institutions, addressing systemic racism, recognizing intersectionality in promoting diversity and inclusion, involving young aspiring poets from diverse backgrounds, collaborating with local organizations supporting marginalized communities, showcasing the intersectionality of race and gender, creating a safe and inclusive space, incorporating elements of different cultural music styles and Black LGBTQ+ voices, actively listening to marginalized voices, continuously educating themselves on issues of diversity and inclusion, talking about dismantling systemic inequalities, putting words into action, advocating for meaningful change, and working towards creating a more equitable and just society.) @ the Ville:Oak Hill College:library:library table
